page.title: 02Edith Weston Village
page.content: Edith Weston village is relatively large. The village has a 12th century church with a whipping post and a one handed Commonwealth Clock.In the Church the top of the font was given to the village to mark 60 years of Queen Victoria's reign. It has one surgery,a primary school and also a village hall which is being rebuilt with an extension.There are two shops, one a Post Office and the other a General Store. Opposite the Post Office is a Silver Jubilee monument placed there in 1977. There was an old school now used as a house.
